title: Getting Started
content: Install ContextVault in seconds. Works on macOS, Linux, and Windows. Two-tier documentation system for any AI coding assistant via MCP or Claude Code native.

title: MCP Server Installation
content: Install ContextVault MCP server with npx contextvault-mcp. Works with Cursor, Windsurf, OpenCode, Cline, Continue, Copilot CLI, and Claude Code. Universal installation via Model Context Protocol.

title: MCP Configuration
content: Configure ContextVault MCP server in your AI tool. Add to mcpServers config in Cursor, Windsurf, Cline, or any MCP-compatible tool. JSON configuration examples for each tool.

title: macOS/Linux Installation
content: Install on macOS or Linux using curl. Run the bash installer script from ctx-vault.com. Native Claude Code installation with hooks and slash commands.

title: Windows Installation
content: Install on Windows using PowerShell. Native PowerShell installer with Git Bash support for hooks.

title: MCP vs Native Comparison
content: Compare MCP server vs native bash installer. MCP works with any AI tool (Cursor, Windsurf, Cline). Native provides Claude Code hooks and slash commands. Both use the same vault format.

title: Upgrade Guide
content: Complete guide to upgrading ContextVault. Update global installation, restart Claude Code, then upgrade each project. MCP auto-updates via npx.

title: Global Upgrade
content: Upgrade global ContextVault installation with curl installer. Updates CLAUDE.md, commands, and hooks.

title: Project Upgrade
content: Upgrade project-level ContextVault with /ctx-upgrade command. Updates project CLAUDE.md and settings.

title: Two-Tier Architecture
content: Global vault at ~/.contextvault/ (or ~/.claude/vault/) for cross-project knowledge. Project vault at ./.contextvault/ (or ./.claude/vault/) for project-specific docs. MCP and native share the same vault format.

title: MCP Architecture
content: MCP server architecture for ContextVault. stdio-based server with 25 tools and 4 auto-loaded resources. Works with any MCP-compatible AI tool. No API keys, no cloud, 100% local.

title: Document Prefixes
content: G### prefix for global documents. P### prefix for project documents. Automatic ID assignment.

title: Index System
content: Index.md files track all documents. Always read indexes first. Update index after every change.

title: Smart Hooks
content: Automatic reminders to document work. SessionStart, PreToolUse, and Stop hooks. Configurable enforcement. Native Claude Code only — MCP uses server-side enforcement instead.

title: Enforcement Levels
content: Light, balanced, and strict enforcement modes. Control how aggressively hooks remind you to document.

title: Vault Modes
content: Local mode uses only project vault. Global mode uses only global vault. Full mode uses both.

title: MCP Server Configuration
content: Configure the MCP server for Cursor, Windsurf, Cline, and other tools. JSON config examples. Hooks are Claude Code native only — MCP uses server-side enforcement.

title: Settings File
content: settings.json configures vault behavior. Set mode, enforcement, and limits.

title: Document Limits
content: Max 50 global docs, 50 project docs. Max 100 lines per document. Max 15 words per summary.

title: First Project Setup
content: Tutorial for setting up ContextVault in your first project. Step by step initialization. MCP or native installation.

title: Documenting Bug Fixes
content: Best practices for documenting bug fixes with ctx-error. Include error, cause, solution.

title: Session Handoffs
content: How to create effective session handoffs. Ensure continuity between sessions.

title: Supported AI Tools
content: ContextVault works with Claude Code, Cursor, Windsurf, OpenCode, Cline, Continue, Copilot CLI, and any MCP-compatible AI coding tool. MCP server for universal support, bash installer for Claude Code native.

title: MCP vs Native: Which should I choose?
content: Choose MCP if you use Cursor, Windsurf, Cline, or want universal compatibility. Choose native bash installer if you use Claude Code exclusively and want hooks and slash commands. You can use both side by side.

title: MCP Troubleshooting
content: Common MCP server issues: tool not connecting, vault not found, npx errors. Check your mcpServers config, ensure Node.js is installed, verify vault directory exists.

title: Why documents not loading?
content: Check that index.md exists and is properly formatted. Run ctx-health to diagnose issues.

title: How to migrate existing docs?
content: Use ctx-import to bring external documentation into the vault. Follow naming conventions.

title: Hooks not working?
content: Hooks require Claude Code native installation. On Windows, Git Bash is needed. MCP uses server-side enforcement instead of hooks.

title: Natural Language Commands
content: Use ContextVault commands three ways: /ctx-* slash commands in Claude Code, ctx_* MCP tools in any AI tool, or natural language like 'document this bug fix' or 'create a session handoff'.
